page.title: 15Birdbrook.Amenities,Farms.
page.content: Birdbrook has an attractive Community House which used to be the school.It changed in 1957-8.We also saw the Old Chapel which was quite big.We looked at the door which had lovely patterns on the hinges.Bailey Hill Farm grows mostly Barley and is farmed by Mr Unwin who owns 400 acres in the area.There is a village shop and when it was built,it was intended to be a sub-post office but that fell through and so the shop is really too big and has to be kept well stocked to fill up the space.The village would have liked a post office.There is a village pond with ducks and a pub called The Plough which serves lunches and evening meals.Many of the farms in the Birdbrook area are still protected by moats-Moat Farm,Whitleys, Birdbrook Hall.
